hadiths.english_translation: From Ali ibn Zaid ibn Judaan from Abu Nadrah from Abu Said al-Khudri: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ led us in the Asr prayer one day at noon, then stood and addressed us until the sun set, and he did not leave anything that will happen until the Day of Judgment except he narrated to us. Whoever memorized it memorized it, and whoever forgot it forgot it. And of what he said was: O people, the worldly life is green and sweet, and Allah will make you successors in it, so He will see how you act. Beware of the worldly life and beware of women. Beware, for every traitor will have a banner on the Day of Judgment by the measure of his betrayal, hoisted at his back, and no traitor has a greater banner than a leader of the public.

Verily, anger is a coal in the heart of the son of Adam that is kindled. Did you not see the redness of his eyes and the swelling of his veins? If any of you finds that, let him sit, or he said: let him stick to the ground.

hadiths.english_translation: Umar ibn al-Khattab sent to Sa'id ibn Amir al-Jumahi to appoint him as governor over some of the Levant, but Sa'id refused and evaded him. Umar said: By the One in whose hand is my soul, you will not place this in your neck and sit in your houses. When Sa'id saw that Umar was serious and would not leave him, he gave him advice saying: Fear Allah, O Umar! Establish your face and your judgment for those who entrusted you from close and distant Muslims. Love for people what you love for yourself and your family, and hate for them what you hate for yourself and your family. Do not judge with two judgments in one matter, so your opinion becomes confused and you deviate from truth. Wade into difficult matters for the sake of truth and do not fear any blame in the way of Allah. Umar said: Who can bear that, O Sa'id? He said: Whoever Allah has cut in his neck like what He cut in yours. Your command is only to command and be obeyed, or be disobeyed and have the proof.

Ali said: Place him in the position of the believer from Pharaoh's people: And if he be a liar, upon him is the burden of his lie, and if he be truthful, some of what he promises you will befall you (Surah Ghafir 28). Uthman said to him: Be silent, dust in your mouth. Ali said: Rather, dust in your mouth. You asked us to appoint you and we appointed you.

hadiths.english_translation: From Abaan ibn Samah from Ubaidullah ibn Mu'adh from Makhld ibn Malik from Abd al-Rahman ibn Sulaym: I was in Kufa in my house when I heard at the door: Assalamu alaikum, may I enter? I said: Wa alaikum assalam, enter. When he entered, behold it was Abdullah ibn Mas'ud. I said: Abu Abd al-Rahman, what time of visiting is this (meaning it was midday)? He said: The day became long for me, so I remembered whom to speak with. He narrated to me from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and I narrated to him. Then he began narrating to me, saying: I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ say: There will be a tribulation. The sleeping in it is better than the reclining, the reclining better than the sitting, the sitting better than the standing, the standing better than the walking, the walking better than the riding, and the riding better than the running. All those killed in it are in the Fire. I said: O Messenger of Allah, when will that be? He said: In the days of chaos (harj). I said: And when are the days of chaos? He said: When a man does not trust his companion. I said: O Messenger of Allah, what do you command me if I reach that time? He said: Guard yourself and your hand and enter your house. I said: O Messenger of Allah, what if a man enters my house? He said: Enter your house. I said: O Messenger of Allah, what if a man enters my house? He said: Enter your mosque and do this, and he placed his right hand on his left wrist, and say: My Lord is Allah, until you die on that.
